div.l: How fares thei faire doghter and thi wif
Aleyn welcome quod Symkyn by my lif
And Iohn also how now what do ye here
By god quod Iohn need hath no peree
Hym be houes serue hym self that hath no swein
Or elles he is a fool as clerkes sayn
Oure Maunciple y hope he wol be ded
Swa wirkes ay the wanges in his hed
And ther fore is I come and ek Aleyn
To grynde oure corn and cari ham a gayne
I pray you sped vs hethen that we may
It shal be don quod Symkyn bi my fay
What wil ye doon whil that it is in hande
By god right bi the hoper wol y stonde
Quod Iohn and se howe the corn gas In
Yit saugh y neuer͗e by my fader kyn
How that the hoꝑper wagges til and fra
Aleyn answerde Iohn wiltow swa
Thanne wol y be bynethe bi my corn
And se how the mele falles doun
In the trogh that shal be my desport
For Iohn in faith I may ben of youre sort
I is as elle a Miller as er ye
This Miller͗e Smyled of hir nycete
And thoghte al this nys don but for a wile
Thei wene no man may hem be gile
But by my threfte yit shal y blere hir eye
For al the sleigthe in hir philosophie
The more wol y stele whan y take
For al the quynte knakkes that they make
In stede of floure yit wol y yeue hem bren
The grettest clerkes ne be nat wisest men
As whilom to tho wolf thus spak the mare
Of al hir art counte y noght a tare
